page.title: 20BAILIFF BRIDGE
page.content: Bailiff Bridge is a very old place. In the middle of the crossroads there was a fountain. Horses used to drink from the fountain. There also used to be a railway station and it was up Birkby Lane. One day a truck caught fire and crashed into the station and,with the station having gas heaters, it blew up. Trams used to run to Bailiff Bridge but they stopped by the Punch Bowl and then started again by the newsagents. You had to change trams because the size of the lines were different. One day a lorry rolled down the hill slowly and then faster and faster. The man who owned the shop was not hurt but the driver of the lorry was killed and so was a lady who had gone in for her pension.
